task.title: DFST Container Quick Start
task.shortdesc: If you are familiar with Docker you can follow these instructions to get going as quickly as possible. NOTE: These instructions are really just a placeholder. Once we have a complete set of composed Docker containers it will not be necessary to get and run the containers individually.

li.p: On Windows and OS X you must have the Docker Toolbox installed and running. See the Docker documentation for details on how to run Docker. All Docker commands are run from the Docker command window (Windows) or from a terminal window with the Docker environment set (OS X).
Under OS X you can use the Kitematic application to start a new Docker window or you can use the command:eval $(docker-machine env default)
To set the Docker environment in your current terminal window.

info.p: See the GitLab Docker documentation: http://doc.gitlab.com/omnibus/docker/ for details.

step.stepresult: Docker should download and install the container. You should see messages like this when it's done:Status: Downloaded newer image for gitlab/gitlab-ce:latest Eliots-MBP:dfst-docker ekimber$
